snippet: The United Nations appeared to move a step closer on Thursday to holding North Korea’s government accountable for what an investigative panel has called a history of crimes against humanity.
abstract: United Nations appears to move step closer to holding North Korea’s government accountable for what an investigative panel has called history of crimes against humanity and egregious human rights abuses; Security Council convenes special session to hear panel's views on what should be done.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations appeared to move a step closer on Thursday to holding North Korea’s government accountable for what an investigative panel has called a history of crimes against humanity.

headline.main: U.N. Council Takes Up Question of Rights in North Korea
headline.print_headline: U.N. Council Takes Up Question of Rights in North Korea
